latex glove | vale imra jiayi 1/31/2025 2:07 PM
As the promised day of the Playwright's festival approaches, Phileas sends word that he will be starting the portal for anyone willing to travel to Dreto, and try to acquire the heart of light before the Servants of the God of Dreams get their hands on it. As the runes on the portal start to glow with a bright, shimmering light, the familiar landscape of Raehn starts to warp and shift, folding in on itself as if two ends of a thread are brought together so that the whole length of the thread is shortened to the tiniest distance. For a moment the teleportation starts to freeze, and the surrounding world is a smudge of swirled colors, like a massive world made of an abstract painting. Those with the mark feel a touch on their hands, and when they look up, they see a clone of themselves grasping at their hands-- but one that's smiling. The clone gives their hands a comforting squeeze, and nods, before disappearing into the warping color as if they were made of a watery paint, and a harsh wind had blown the image into unrecognizability. When the environment clears, the tranquil scenery of Aplens, the capital city of Dreto, can be seen beyond.
2:07 PM
The glimmering waters of the Orozen river twine next to the eastern entrance of the city of Aplens. Many visiting Aplens come via boat or raft, but travelers on foot must cross the Wyrmbone bridge. Though it’s insisted it’s truly made from a dragon’s bones, the black material has been carved and shaped into a smooth, straight path, with half arches descending into the water to prop it up. Inclusions like shards of fire opal can occasionally be seen shining within the material. It leads to Aplens itself, lush forests framing the pale buildings crowned by domes. Before the length of the bridge are familiar faces, merchants from Triem Sha, with large turtles carrying their wagons and their wares. Arrash seems displeased about something, and Bejun is staring at the distant city. Ahmuhia glances back, her bright green eyes widening at the familiar faces she thought she might never see again. Her fanged mouth splits into a wide grin, and she lifts her hand in a wave, beckoning all to come over and talk. (edited)

Dreto, he's been here one too many times, though most of them have been for work. The blue waters, just beneath his feet makes him wonder how a younger version of himself might have skipped school to jump in with friends. Freyr BOT 2/1/2025 1:02 AM
A white veil, marred with black frayed edges hides most of her away from the people present. She makes no attempt to pull it back, shying away from the crowd. Her wings, colored white in disguise, leave behind petals that are carried by the wind as they wait for the portal. Freyr keeps themselves at a distance with the people she notes there, never one to disturb the balance. She is not presumptuous enough to claim she is sent by the divine on a mission, but what else could this be? The teleportation happens as it always does, though with much more satisfactory results. The mirror image that lingers to gaze upon herself robs her of warmth. The smile they wear bewilders the saintess, a reassurance that she can never be confident to convey. Their trailing fingertips brush against each other, and Freyr watches them become part of the backdrop they leave behind, the cosmos swallowing them into bursts of vivid color. The absence felt is wide, and she stares behind, until the entirety of their makeshift twin has disappeared. What a familiar feeling, and an equally familiar sight. As the portal stabilizes, Freyr finds her feet grounded on the soil. Her heels daintily press atop the earth, and her eyes reflect not herself, but the ever bright city of Dreto in the distance. She had been here not too long ago, dressed in an outfit that didn't suit her self imposed visage, but for similar reasons to their goal now. The bridge hangs over luscious and clean waters. Freyr moves to see the rippling reflection of those traveling alongside them, wondering how far the depths went. But there are more comforting sights to see. "Hello, it has been a long while." Freyr says softly, delighted in greeting the familiar faces.

Lancefiend Livingstone BOT 2/1/2025 10:12 AM
The gentle tapping of a cane on stone accompanies the crowd of the Cursed, and others traversing the Wyrmbone Bridge into Aplens. Even within the myriad of cultures making up the travelers coming into the city, a tall white lion xanthi might still stick out like a bit of a sore thumb. Lancefiend walks along with the others, sporting a fresh emerald overcoat over a lilac vest and a white ruffled shirt. He runs a paw through his freshly-brushed and coiffed mane, relieved--almost surprised--to feel fresh air caress his fur. After a long while of sequestering himself away in Raehn's libary and gardens, he'd grown used to the rather stale breeze of the place and consigned himself to his sorrow at some of the city's recent affairs. Perhaps it was an escape from that, however temporary, which propelled him to take this journey to Dreto with the others. Yet this whole business with elemental Hearts and the God of Dreams was also...oddly intriguing as well, or perhaps perturbing. Either way, Lancefiend was curious, if not wary, about where the course of the Cursed would lead...and surely there needed to be someone to supervise all that, right?

WHIPSTITCH BOT 2/1/2025 1:49 PM
An imposing figure stands awkwardly off to the side of everyone else--as stiff as his own disposition is the air around him. Whipstitch does not feel like he has a use to any of these people or for whatever mission they aim to achieve but because of his involvement in previous endeavors he feels a sense of duty to report. Besides, he had become rather listless these days with no goal or person to serve. Every day seemed to be meaninglessly passing and he had made no use of any of it. This was good for him, he thinks, for if he were to continue to stagnantly exist so comfortably he might as well be a pile of junk in a trash yard somewhere. An expendable body was helpful; it was what he was made to be. He had to keep reminding himself that that was enough of a reason to just show up. Anyone who was willing. Dreto was a place he had never step foot in nor was it a place he had even a chance to catch a glimpse of. She had told him in passing of such a place but nothing that would be useful for him now. Her tone was always dreamy and fantasizing yet bitter and somber. He knew it was a place she wished to go to or even inhabit one day but for her it was not possible. And yet here he was in her place. The thought made the corners of his mouth turn downwards even further than they already had been. Any more and the whole playing of his jaw might just fall off. The teleportation itself was enough to disorient him to the point that he felt ill. At any point all of his insides could spill out but he is being so strong and keeping it in. He shouldn't even be feeling any type of sickness from motion or what have you, but he images this is what someone would feel if they did. So he swallows back an invisible lump of bile and stands very very still. Still as a rock--or a boulder would be more accurate, the whirring and ticking of the machinations within seemingly pounding in contrast to his silence. Even when the visions of the opulence of the festival finally reach hi (edited)
